intro: Microcos conocarpa, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that persist through the winter, providing food for various wildlife species. The plant has compound leaves with five to seven oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces yellowish-white flowers in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant in warm climates. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically valuable addition to native plant gardens.
